result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler O Mckuen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay a fine of $150.00 including all applicable costs and surcharges. Cash bail on deposit to apply. Court waived the DNA surcharge as no sample was taken. Court ordered the defendant to pay the County back for attorney fees. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler O Mckuen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP case.
for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs signed and filed on 8/20/15.  rmm

Defendant Tyler O Mckuen in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing on the withheld sentence.  Defendant has complete a parenting class and anger management.  Court ordered the domestic abuse enhancer struck.  Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $150.0  including all applicable costs and surcharges.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Court waived the DNA surcharge as no sample was taken.  Court ordered the defendant to pay the County back for attorney fees.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Defendant Tyler O Mckuen in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Defendant has to complete 2 more sessions in the anger management.  Court ordered matter adjourned so defendant can complete the course.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tyler O Mckuen in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  Evan K Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
.
AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
.
AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Sentencing proceeded. Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
.
AS TO COUNT 1: Court withheld sentence and ordered defendant complete an anger management class and a parenting class.  Court advised defendant that the no contact violent order remains in effect. Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Email from the victim received and filed.  Court modified the no contact order to a no violent contact order.  Parties may not live together and defendant must be absolutely sober.

Defendant Tyler O Mckuen in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 3/11/15 in Branch 40.  Defense is still trying to get a DPA.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
Attorney Fee Trust - Escrow payment plan created 01/27/2015 to repay Milwaukee County 50.00 monthly for attorney fees. First payment commencing 03/01/215.

Defendant Tyler O Mckuen in court.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Mayaan Silver as counsel for defendant at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  Attorney Silver accepts appointment.  Order signed and filed.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 3/01/15 until paid in full. Order signed and filed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JACQUELINE C. OR HER CHILDREN.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
COURT ORDERED CASH BAIL PREVIOULSY POSTED.

Defendant Tyler O Mckuen in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 40.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/14/15 @ 1:30 pm
